title: Pakistan in big danger? Ex-Pak star guarantees 'US will beat Pakistan again'
content: Former Pakistan bowler Mohammad Asif warns the national team against the United States in their upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 match, predicting another upset. He recalls the dramatic Super Over loss in the 2024 edition, where USA secured a historic victory. Asif believes history could repeat itself, putting Pakistan's campaign at risk.

title: 118 MPs move no-confidence against Om Birla: How does motion to remove Speaker work
content: The Congress has filed a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, citing partisan conduct during the Budget session. The opposition alleges denial of speaking time to Rahul Gandhi and suspension of MPs. This extraordinary step, supported by 118 MPs, aims to address perceived undemocratic practices in Parliament.

title: Anthropic faces 'naming trouble' in India; Anthropic Software founder files lawsuit
content: US-based AI startup Anthropic is facing a lawsuit in India from a local software company also named Anthropic. The Indian firm claims prior use of the name and is seeking damages due to customer confusion amid Anthropic's expansion plans in the country. The Karnataka court has issued a notice to the AI firm.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: ‘Best player I’ve ever seen’: Why Buttler made a bold claim about Sooryavanshi
content: England cricketer Jos Buttler has lauded Indian prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, calling the 14-year-old the "best player I've ever seen" after his record-breaking 175 in the U-19 World Cup final. Sooryavanshi's explosive innings secured India's sixth title and ignited discussions about cricket's next generational superstar.

title: Gold price today: How much 18K, 22K and 24K gold costs in Delhi, Mumbai & more
content: Gold prices fell on Tuesday, with April futures dropping to Rs 1.57 lakh per 10 grams due to profit-booking and a stronger US dollar. Internationally, silver also saw a decline. The article also provides current gold prices per gram for 24K, 22K, and 18K gold in various Indian cities.

title: T20 World Cup: Bas de Leede's all-round brilliance helps Netherlands beat Namibia by 7 wickets
content: Bas de Leede starred with bat and ball as the Netherlands bounced back from their narrow loss to Pakistan to register their first win of the T20 World Cup, beating Namibia by seven wickets in Delhi. Asked to bat first, Namibia scored 156 for eight. In reply, Netherlands chased down the target of 157 in 18 overs

title: Salesforce job cuts: Impacted teams include Agentforce AI product central to business
content: Salesforce has reportedly laid off nearly 1,000 employees across various departments, including marketing, product management, and data analytics. This comes as the company emphasizes its Agentforce AI product, which CEO Marc Benioff has called "part and parcel" of Salesforce. The job cuts coincide with a significant executive shake-up, with six new senior appointments following five top leaders' exits since December.

title: Indian exports to hit $1 tn soon? Exporters expect boost from trade deals with US, EU
content: Indian exporters anticipate $1 trillion in goods and services outflows by 2026-27, fueled by new trade agreements with the US and EU.  US tariff cuts from 50% to 18% on Indian products are already boosting orders in sectors like chemicals and footwear.  Exporters are optimistic about increased market share, though capacity and implementation clarity remain key discussion points.

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Madras HC drops CBFC case; Vijay's film sent for recheck
content: The Madras High Court has dismissed the case against the CBFC regarding the film 'Jana Nayagan', allowing producers to withdraw. This clears the path for the film's re-examination, with a new committee expected to provide an opinion within 20 days. If certified, the political-social drama starring Thalapathy Vijay could release in early March.

title: Harshit Rana undergoes surgery, may miss major part of IPL too
content: Fast bowler Harshit Rana underwent successful knee surgery on Monday, ruling him out of the T20 World Cup and a significant portion of the upcoming IPL season. The injury occurred during a warm-up match, and Rana will now begin rehabilitation at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru.

title: Why was Bengaluru techie targeted in Canada? Kin flag 'Kannada association push'
content: A Karnataka-born tech professional, Chandan Kumar Raja Nandakumar, was fatally shot in a targeted attack outside a Toronto mall. His family suspects his efforts to establish a Kannada association in the city might be linked to the incident. The 37-year-old was actively promoting Kannada culture before his tragic death.

title: Say hello to rail passes: Why Indians are swaping flights for train trips in Europe?
content: Indian travelers are increasingly opting for rail passes to explore Europe and East Asia, driven by rising travel costs and a desire for predictable expenses.  This trend sees India becoming a significant market for passes like Eurail and the Swiss Travel Pass, with families also embracing train travel for multi-country adventures.

title: Is your home vastu compliant? 5 ways to know and how to the issues
content: Discover Vastu Shastra's secrets to a harmonious home! This ancient science balances five elements for positivity.  A quick five-step checklist evaluates your main door, kitchen, master bedroom, sunlight, and room shapes. Learn simple fixes like using mirrors, colors, plants, metals, and water features to enhance your living space and well-being.

title: Sonu Sood stands by Rajpal Yadav; actor promises him a role; urges film industry to help
content: Actor Sonu Sood has rallied the film industry to support Rajpal Yadav, who surrendered in a cheque-bounce case and is now in Tihar Jail. Sood pledged to cast Yadav in his upcoming film, emphasizing dignity over charity for struggling artists. Yadav's legal troubles stem from an unpaid Rs 5 crore loan taken for his directorial venture.

title: Russian oil imports: Trump admin may give refunds for small penalties on India - check details
content: In an executive order issued on February 6, the Trump administration said that Indian goods entering the US for consumption, or released from warehouses for consumption, on or after 12:01 a.m. Eastern Standard Time on February 7, 2026, would no longer be subject to the additional 25% ad valorem duty previously imposed.

title: T20 World Cup | India vs Pakistan to go ahead: It's all about the money, honey!
content: The highly anticipated India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match is confirmed, averting significant financial losses. Back-channel talks between the ICC, PCB, and BCB secured the fixture's continuation. This clash is a commercial powerhouse, generating millions in advertising and impacting broadcast rights negotiations, making its potential cancellation a major concern for all stakeholders.

title: ‘All the pressure on Pakistan’: USA eye another T20 WC shock as old wounds resurface
content: Pakistan face immense pressure in their T20 World Cup encounter against the United States, still haunted by a past upset.  The American side, bolstered by a near-shock against India and insider knowledge from a former Pakistani player, feels confident.  Pakistan, having narrowly escaped defeat in their opener, acknowledges the rising threat of emerging teams.

title: 'I quit engineering in 3rd year,' writes 21-year-old: How to rebuild career after dropping out
content: A student's decision to leave engineering midway through their degree highlights a growing trend of career uncertainty. After struggling with coursework and internships, they are exploring new paths, seeking financial stability and growth. The article advises separating emotion from direction, evaluating transferable skills, considering trades, and prioritizing action over endless research to rebuild a fulfilling career.

title: Twist in Kanpur Lamborghini case: Lawyer says tobacco baron's son not driving, cops counter with CCTV
content: A Lamborghini Revuelto worth over Rs 10 crore crashed on Kanpur's VIP Road, hitting pedestrians and parked vehicles. CCTV footage and eyewitnesses place Shivam Mishra, son of a tobacco tycoon, at the wheel, despite his lawyer's claims of a designated driver. Police have rejected the defense's assertion and are proceeding with the investigation.

title: Endocrinologist shares a simple morning routine to keep blood sugar stable before breakfast
content: Morning routines significantly impact blood sugar, even for those managing diet. Dr. Mohit Sharma suggests a six-step plan: quiet wake-up, water intake, light activity, sunlight exposure, delayed caffeine, and a protein-rich breakfast. These steps help lower stress hormones, improve glucose uptake, and regulate the body's natural rhythms, leading to better blood sugar control.

title: India match schedule for T20 World Cup: All India upcoming matches, timings, venues
content: Team India has started its T20 World Cup 2026 journey with a victory over the United States. The team will now face Namibia, followed by a significant match against Pakistan. India will conclude its group stage games against the Netherlands.

title: Tata Punch EV facelift: Five big changes you need to know
content: Even though the Punch EV facelift is expected to retain the same battery and motor setup as the current model, it could deliver a slightly improved driving range due to updated software calibrations. The Punch EV is expected to carry forward the same battery pack options - Standard and Long Range. The standard gets a 25kWh battery with 315km of MIDC range and the LR variant gets a 35kWh battery with 421km of MIDC range.

title: Trophy in hand, Mustafizur Rahman posts one-word message
content: Dhumketu XI, featuring Mustafizur Rahman, clinched the Odommo Bangladesh T20 Cup title after a thrilling seven-run victory over Durbar XI. Tanzid Hasan's unbeaten 88 was the cornerstone of Dhumketu's imposing 208/3. Despite strong efforts from Durbar's batsmen, Mustafizur's crucial wickets in the death overs secured the championship for his side.

title: Freedom of digital expression upheld: SC rules profanity is not per se obscenity
content: The Supreme Court thoroughly reviewed the notion of obscenity, legislative framework involved in the application of the Sections 67 and 67A in the Information Technology Act and the judicial standards that were established in the application of Section 292 in the Indian Penal Code.

title: Rohit Shetty firing case gets new twist; Crime Branch links trail to Bishnoi gang
content: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty's home was targeted by four gunshots, with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang claiming responsibility via a Facebook post warning him against interference. The Mumbai Crime Branch has identified Asaram Fasle as the weapon supplier, linked to the gang through Shubham Lonkar.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang claims daylight killing of Delhi bizman, issues chilling warning
content: A businessman was shot dead in North Delhi's Bawana area, with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang claiming responsibility via social media. The victim, Vaibhav Gandhi, was allegedly targeted for interfering with the gang's operations. Police are investigating the claim, which points to a conspiracy involving extortion and organized crime.

title: Alcohol access for expats in Saudi Arabia: Rules and eligibility
content: Saudi Arabia has quietly begun selling alcohol to wealthy, non-Muslim foreign residents, a significant shift after over 70 years of prohibition. This move, linked to Vision 2030, targets affluent expats with premium residency and high incomes, signaling a cautious approach to social liberalization aimed at boosting tourism and investment. Further expansion is reportedly planned.

title: Asian Shooting: Jaspal Rana debarred from FOP for dress code violation
content: National coach Jaspal Rana was sidelined from the Field of Play during Manu Bhaker's 25m pistol event due to a dress code violation. Despite this, Bhaker secured a silver medal. Meanwhile, a junior shooter named Anjali Bhagwat, inspired by the Olympian, clinched her first international bronze in the same event.

title: Rajpal makes an emotional statement before surrendering to Tihar jail
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail following a cheque bounce case involving approximately Rs 2.5 crore. The legal battle stems from a 2010 loan for his directorial venture, which failed at the box office. Despite years of appeals and partial repayments, the court dismissed his final extension request, citing a lack of seriousness.

title: Gold price prediction: Will volatility continue in near-term? What investors should know
content: Gold price prediction today: Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan is of the view that the gold price rally looks overextended. What’s the outlook for gold prices in the coming days? Here’s what he has to say:

title: White House releases fact sheet on India–US trade deal, outlines ‘path forward’ — key details
content: India and the United States have reached a new interim trade agreement. Washington is withdrawing additional duties on Indian imports. India will lower duties on American industrial and agricultural goods. New Delhi also pledges to significantly increase imports from the US. Negotiations for a comprehensive trade deal will continue.

title: Indian-origin techie from Karnataka shot dead in ‘targeted’ attack outside Canada mall
content: A 37-year-old Indian tech professional, Chandan Kumar Raja Nandakumar, was killed in a daylight shooting in Toronto. The incident occurred at a busy shopping mall parking lot. Police are investigating the shooting as a targeted attack. Chandan's family in Karnataka is devastated. He had moved to Canada six years ago and worked for LTI Mindtree.

title: Rupee in red: Currency falls 11 paise to 90.77 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee opened weaker against the US dollar, falling 11 paise to 90.77. Traders adopted a cautious stance following the interim trade framework announcement, reassessing initial optimism due to ongoing US oversight on energy imports. Near-term movement will depend on key support levels holding, with the RBI expected to intervene on dips.

title: Minus Peterson, KU hands No. 1 Arizona first loss
content: Flory Bidunga had a double-double, and No. 9 Kansas defeated top-ranked and previously unbeaten Arizona 82-78 on Monday night.

title: Four tossed after brawl in Pistons-Hornets game
content: A fight broke out between the Pistons and Hornets on Monday night, leading to the ejections of Charlotte's Moussa Diabate and Miles Bridges and Detroit's Jalen Duren and Isaiah Stewart.

title: 49ers DL White shot in ankle in San Francisco
content: 49ers defensive lineman Keion White underwent surgery Monday after he was shot in the ankle in San Francisco hours after Super Bowl LX concluded.

title: Judge denies Bediako's motion to play for Alabama
content: An Alabama circuit judge on Monday denied Alabama basketball player Charles Bediako's motion for a preliminary injunction, ending the 7-foot center's college eligibility and his season with the Crimson Tide.

title: Vonn says she suffered complex tibia fracture
content: Lindsey Vonn said Monday in a post on Instagram that she suffered a complex tibia fracture "that will require multiple surgeries to fix properly" when she crashed in the downhill Sunday.

title: Raiders officially name Kubiak new head coach
content: The Raiders officially announced Klint Kubiak as the team's new head coach Monday, a day after he helped the Seahawks win Super Bowl LX.

title: Njoku confirms longtime Browns tenure is over
content: Impending free agent tight end David Njoku, who has played his first nine years in the NFL with the Browns, will not return to Cleveland in 2026.

title: St. John's Pitino climbs wins list, at expense of son
content: St. John's outlasted Xavier 87-82 on Monday night at Madison Square Garden, giving coach Rick Pitino his 904th career win on the court to pass Roy Williams for third place in Division I history behind Mike Krzyzewski and Jim Boeheim.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Mikaela Shiffrin makes Milan debut, U.S. women's hockey plays Canada and more live updates
content: On Tuesday at the Winter Olympics, the U.S. women's hockey team faces Canada, and skier Mikaela Shiffrin makes her Milan debut.

title: 'It's going to be an intense one': U.S.-Canada in women's hockey is one of the best rivalries in sports
content: How is each team playing? Who are the key players in Tuesday's preliminary-round game? We break down the first meeting between the rivals at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

title: 'A glitch in the matrix': How does Ilia Malinin do what seems impossible?
content: Figure skater Ilia Malinin intends to land a quad axel -- along with other unique tricks -- at the Winter Olympics.

title: What Klint Kubiak hire means for Las Vegas: two-RB system, more 12-personnel and a potential Mendoza pairing
content: The Raiders hired Klint Kubiak. Here's what that means for Las Vegas, plus what's next in the offseason.

title: Drake Maye lost his first Super Bowl. His future -- and the Patriots' -- remains bright
content: Drake Maye and the Patriots weren't able to do much in Super Bowl LX, but their future might still be bright.

title: Next season already? Our Way-Too-Early NFL Power Rankings stack all 32 teams for 2026
content: After the conclusion of the 2025 NFL season, how do all 32 teams stack up for 2026? Here are our early rankings for next season.

title: Offseason guide for every NFL team
content: What must each team do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: What this NBA trade deadline revealed: Teams are finding new ways to tank
content: Much to the irritation of some league insiders, the trade deadline was more than just a flurry of moves: It showed the next evolution in teams racing to the bottom.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Iowa's inch to lock status, more results from a packed weekend
content: Iowa, USC pulled out wins but Ohio State, UCF, West Virginia, Tulsa have work to do after a mixed bubble Sunday.

title: What the Charles Bediako ruling means for Alabama and future NCAA eligibility cases
content: The former two-way NBA player's request to keep playing for his old college team was denied. Here's what it means.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke up, Louisville down, UConn still the 1
content: The No. 11 Blue Devils were the biggest mover in the women's AP Top 25 poll. Here's what's next for every team.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Making sense of Super Bowl LX: The Seahawks mixed up their game plan, and the Patriots couldn't adapt
content: Let's size up Seattle's defensive wrinkles, an explosive RB, great special teams and Sam Darnold's performance.

title: Nothing left to prove, resilient Sam Darnold makes ultimate statement
content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: An inside look at how an Olympic ice dance routine is crafted
content: With '90s music as the theme for the 2026 Winter Olympics, ice dance routines have included everything from Madonna to the Spice Girls.

title: Super Bowl records: Who holds the all-time marks after the Seahawks beat the Patriots?
content: Here is a look at Super Bowl records such as most points, most touchdowns and Tom Brady's all-time totals.

title: We ranked every Super Bowl champion, 1-60: How do the 2025 Seahawks stack up?
content: How good was the 2025 Seahawks team? We ranked the Super Bowl LX winner against the other 59 champions.

title: UWCL playoff round preview: Can Arsenal maintain winning momentum?
content: The inaugural UWCL playoff round begins this week, with a host of big clubs -- including Arsenal -- fighting for a spot in the quarterfinals. Here's what you need to know about all four match-ups.

title: Klopp, Alonso, Guardiola: Predicting what happens to Europe's top managers this summer
content: With the Real Madrid and Manchester United jobs up for grabs, one thing is for certain this summer: The world's best managers will be in high demand.

title: Man City's comeback thriller keeps title hopes alive; Liverpool slip further
content: Man City's two unanswered goals means the title race stays alive and Liverpool's UCL hopes are in doubt.

title: NFL playoffs top moments: From Caleb Williams' miracle TD to the Super Bowl MVP﻿
content: Here's a look at the wild and woolly NFL postseason, from frigid temperatures to trick plays and Super Bowl MVPs.

title: NFL futures: Champion Seahawks, Rams atop Super Bowl LXI odds
content: A champion was just crowned, but it's never too early to look ahead. Here are the odds for Super Bowl LXI.

title: Too soon? Early bets to win Super Bowl LXI
content: We're already thinking about Super Bowl LXI. Here are the contenders and odds that caught our analysts' eyes.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Collier, Mathurin, Clifford among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid, Chelsea, Liverpool eye Junior Kroupi
content: Bournemouth forward Junior Kroupi is attracting attention from some of Europe's elite clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Trinamool Congress refuses to sign resolution for Lok Sabha Speaker’s removal
content: Party’s National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee urges a “calibrated” approach on the Speaker’s ouster even as TMC asserts all options exhausted in its bid to impeach Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar

title: Private bus strike on Kannur-Thottada-Thalassery route in Kerala called off
content: Decision follows intervention by Kannur MP K. Sudhakaran who assured District Private Bus Operators Association that the issue would be taken up at appropriate level

title: Rohit Pawar likely to present claims on Ajit Pawar plane crash | Live
content: Ajit Pawar’s nephew wondered if there was any element which ‘can act like a bomb.’ This comes amid doubts raised by several political leaders, including Mamata Banerjee, Sanjay Raut, NCP and NCP (SP) legislators over the issue.

title: Over one lakh people likely to attend two-day Pakala Beach Festival
content: APTDC, Tourism Department and Maritime Board are jointly hosting this maiden event at Pakala Beach in Prakasam district on February 14-15, 2026

title: Caste cauldron bubbles in Uttar Pradesh a year ahead of polls
content: On the one side you have BSP Mayawati, endorsing the Supreme court’s stay on the University Grants Commission (UGC) regulations on equity, on the other was former Union minister Kalraj Mishra, again speaking out on the UGC issue

title: A.P. transfers key forest officers amid Kolleru Lake flashpoint
content: The transfers come days after tensions flared at Kolleru Lake on February 6, when villagers blocked Forest department officials amid a dispute over sanctuary boundaries

title: Assam Congress files police complaint against BJP over controversial video of CM
content: Congress Party legislators Sibamoni Bora and Diganta Barman lodged the complaint at Dispur Police Station in Guwahati

title: Women’s enrolment in higher education up by 34% due to Pudhumai Penn scheme: T.N. CM Stalin
content: A study by the State Planning Commission had shown that girl students from rural areas benefitted more from the scheme than those from urban areas, the Chief Minister said

title: Railway Ministry sanctions funds for two rail projects in Kerala
content: ₹324.16 crore sanctioned for Alappuzha-Ambalapuzha doubling (12.66 km) works, while ₹163.57 crore approved for works on Palakkad Town-Parli bypass line (1.8 km)

title: Congress acquired land for Wayanad landslide victims in just four months, Kerala govt took a year: Satheesan
content: Opposition Leader says Congress party initially had no plans to acquire land, as it was to be provided by Kerala govt, to build 100 houses. ‘However, State govt, at the last moment, informed us of its unwillingness to do so, and therefore we had to acquire land on our own,’ he claims

title: Kanpur newborn death: Nursing home registration cancelled, FIR filed against doctor
content: Officials said the nursing home had been operating the NICU without mandatory approval from the Health Department

title: Allahabad High Court stays order of FIR against ex-Sambhal CO Anuj Chaudhary, other cops
content: The order was passed by Justice Samit Gopal while hearing a petition filed by Mr. Chaudhary, against whom an FIR was ordered on January 9 by the Sambhal chief judicial magistrate.

title: If language protest is a ‘disease’, most States suffer from it, says Raj Thackeray targeting Bhagwat
content: On the issue of Marathi language and identity, the ruling BJP said Marathi is a matter of pride, but stressed that a language should remain a medium of communication rather than conflict

title: Karnataka High Court refuses anticipatory bail to MLA Byrathi Basavaraj in realtor-cum-rowdy-sheeter murder in Bengaluru
content: With the rejection of his petition, the interim anticipatory bail granted on December 26, 2025 got cancelled giving free hand to the CID to arrest him

title: Sridhar Vembu divorce case: Zoho co-founder’s estranged wife approaches Madras High Court to record his testimony
content: Justice P. Dhanabal orders notice, returnable by February 23, to Mr. Vembu on the plea to honour a Letters Rogatory issued by the Superior Court of California in a divorce case

title: Rahul cites Naravane's 'available now' post from 2023 to rebut publisher's claim
content: Rahul Gandhi said M.M. Naravane has made certain statements in the book that are "inconvenient" for the government and Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Former Minister K.S. Eshwarappa to join protest against Sharavati Pumped Storage project in Shivamogga on February 12
content: Former minister K.S. Eshwarappa stated that the project would harm the biodiversity hotspot of the Western Ghats, as its implementation includes blast activities using huge amounts of explosives

title: Deepak death case: Court further defers decision on Shimjitha’s bail plea
content: Kozhikode Principal Sessions Court seeks additional police report to determine whether her continued custody is required for further investigation

title: More houses torched on third day of Kuki-Naga violence, internet suspended in Manipur
content: Internet services have been suspended in Ukhrul district for five days amid reports of armed miscreants opening fire to scare villagers away

title: Bishnoi gang claims responsibility for killing of businessman in Delhi's Bawana
content: When the victim tried to escape, the assailants chased him for about 40 to 50 metres and fired multiple rounds. One bullet struck him in the chin, causing him to collapse, a senior police officer said.

title: Congress submits no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
content: Chief Whip of Congress in the Lok Sabha K. Suresh and Whip Jawed Ahmed handed over the notice to the Secretary-General

title: ASI Epigraphy wing deploys four teams in T.N. to recopy some old inscriptions
content: Currently, the ASI is involved in digitising over 76,000 estampages of inscriptions in several languages. This includes digitising over 25,000 Tamil estampages in its possession as well

title: Ex-UP minister Madan Chauhan escapes assassination attempt in Hapur
content: The incident occurred in the Garhmukteshwar area on February 9, 2026 night when Madan Chauhan was travelling in his car to Hirnapura village

title: Meghalaya coal mine blast: Death toll rises to 30
content: The East Jaintia Hills district authorities called off the rescue operation in the Mynsngat-Thangsko area on February 9, 2026 evening

title: Kanpur luxury car accident: Lawyer says Shivam Mishra wasn't driving; police counter with CCTV, witnesses
content: “The car was being driven by the driver, not by Shivam Mishra. We will present the facts and evidence before the court,” says Advocate Mrityunjay Kumar

title: Supreme Court agrees to urgent hearing of CPI(M) plea for FIR, SIT probe into video depicting Assam CM
content: The CPI(M) leaders sought an FIR into a recent social media post, since deleted, depicting Assam CM Himanta Sarma discharging a firearm toward an animated image of two visibly Muslim men positioned within the crosshairs of the weapon

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Madras High Court permits Vijay-starrer’s producer to withdraw writ petition
content: Justice P.T. Asha dismisses the writ petition as withdrawn after KVN Productions LLP states that it has accepted a reference to the CBFC’s revising committee

title: I-PAC raids: Supreme Court adjourns hearing on ED’s plea for CBI probe into ‘interference’ by CM Mamata to Feb. 18
content: Supreme Court adjourns the hearing after advocate Preetika Dwivedi made an oral mentioning that Kapil Sibal, counsel for West Bengal, was unwell

title: Sexual assault case: Chargesheet filed against former Kerala MLA and filmmaker P.T. Kunju Muhammed
content: Kunju Muhammed chaired the jury which selected Malayalam films for 30th edition of IFFK in 2025. The police case is that he invited a woman filmmaker to his hotel room on the pretext of discussing IFFK selection process and outraged her modesty

title: Switch to RailOne app as Indian Railways will decommission UTSonMobile app from March 1
content: Balance amount in R-Wallet will be available for use on the RailOne App, according to Southern Railway

title: ED summons actor Jayaram for questioning in Sabarimala gold case
content: Move comes in the wake of Jayaram’s association and reported financial transactions with Unnikrishnan Potti, the prime accused in the case. Actor summoned for questioning next week

title: Haryana: Faridabad DCP (NIT) transferred after Surajkund mela tragedy
content: Faridabad DCP (NIT) Maqsood Ahmed transfer comes close on the heels of a swing collapse incident at the Surajkund fairgrounds in Faridabad, in which an on-duty police inspector died during rescue efforts, and 12 others were injured.

title: ED to issue fresh summons to Tina Ambani
content: It is understood that she was called for questioning with regard to a money trail linked to the purchase of a luxury condominium in New York's Manhattan

title: Journalist arrested for objectionable Facebook post on U.P. CM Adityanath in Ballia
content: Citing the FIR, police said the accused posted an objectionable image of UP CM on Facebook on Sunday, accompanied by a controversial caption.

title: BJP women MPs seek action against Opposition MPs alleged to have brought ‘disrepute’ to Lok Sabha
content: The women MPs of the BJP also said that the "alarming turn of events" in the precincts of the Lok Sabha on February 4 has left everyone deeply concerned

title: Sunetra Pawar to take charge as first woman Deputy CM of Maharashtra today
content: Pawar was chosen as the group leader for the NCP Legislature part following the demise of her husband Ajit Pawar in a tragic air crash in Baramati on January 28, 2026

title: Fire breaks out at Attapur car showroom; no injuries reported
content: As a precautionary measure, around 90 residents from a neighbouring residential apartment were evacuated

title: Over 18,700 government schools in Karnataka have no land records
content: Steps are being taken to bring ‘The Karnataka School Education Department Properties Protection Bill 2025 or The Karnataka Protection of Government School/Colleges Properties Bill’ to register properties of public schools in DSEL’s name

title: 18,791 government schools in Karnataka have no land records
content: The government has now taken steps to bring ‘The Karnataka School Education Department Properties Protection Bill 2025 or The Karnataka Protection of Government School/Colleges Properties Bill’ to register the properties of government schools in the name of the DSEL

title: Leo D’Souza, Mangaluru’s Mendel who worked to transform cashew industry
content: Fr Leo built one of India’s earliest plant tissue culture labs and helped crack cashew micropropagation, including a test-tube cashew tree that made it to the soil; he leaves behind a rare Jesuit legacy that fused rigorous science with public purpose, shaping women scientists and vulnerable lives alike

title: GSDP growth of State has outpaced national average, says planning official
content: Andhra Pradesh’s GSDP is estimated at ₹17.62 lakh crore, reflecting a growth of 10.75%, says State Planning Department Principal Secretary Piyush Kumar

title: Why is there a caste-system for trains, asks PAC
content: A BJP member pointed out that there appears to be a “caste system” in trains, with premium services such as the Vande Bharat offering superior linen and cleaner coaches compared to regular passenger trains

title: Naveen Patnaik attacks Mohan Majhi government over paddy procurement
content: Thousands of farmers are spending sleepless nights under the open sky, guarding their paddy from dew and theft, as the lifting of stocks remains agonisingly slow, alleges former CM

title: West Bengal remains destination and source of Bonded Labour
content: Poor workers from Bihar, Jharkhand, and Odisha work as bonded laborers in brick kilns, while the State is also source of youths who end up being bonded labourers in Chennai’s jewellery manufacturing units

title: Indore water contamination: Inquiry panel issued public notice to seek evidence
content: The panel has been tasked with investigating the causes of water pollution, administrative negligence, action against responsible individuals, loss of life, medical effects, and remedial measures

title: Delhi High Court seeks CBI stand on Jaideep Sengar’s plea for extension of interim bail
content: The brother of expelled BJP leader, who was awarded a 10-year jail term in the case by the trial court, said his interim bail was expiring on February 11 and sought an extension as he was suffering from oral cancer

title: No copies of Naravane’s memoir have gone into publication: Publisher
content: The clarification came after the Delhi Police registered an FIR over the alleged illegal circulation of the manuscript in digital and other formats

title: ‘BJP leader’ booked for beating woman in M.P.; video goes viral
content: Such instances are reported regularly; BJP leaders, drunk on power, are seen perpetrating atrocities against women, the Congress said

title: Namma Metro fare hike: Operating and maintenance costs, Consumer Price Index among parameters to recalculate fare
content: Responding to allegations that the State government had sought the fare hike, the Deputy Chief Minister maintained that the decision had been taken much earlier by an independent fare fixation committee

title: Hosur airport not recommended to prioritise defence projects of national importance: Union Civil Aviation Minister
content: He was responding to a question raised by DMK MP S. Kalyanasundaram in the Rajya Sabha on whether the Centre has examined the Hosur airport proposal sent by the State government and the reasons for the delay in granting in-principle approval, airspace clearance and other such permissions

title: Indian coffee steadily moving from commodity-led  to quality, experience-driven market: Coffee Board
content: The tariff reduction from 25% to zero (0%) would boost India’s coffee exports in general and shipments of speciality coffees in particular, said the coffee community, in response to a media query on the impact of recent U.S. tariff reduction on India's coffee exports

title: TMC welcomes Supreme Court intervention in SIR exercise, calls it big victory for West Bengal
content: The ruling party in the State says the latest development blows apart the ‘ECI’s unilateral move to parachute micro-observers exclusively into Bengal to influence, intimidate, and manipulate the process’

title: Trinamool councillor arrested for allegedly ‘beating elderly man to death’ over illegal construction
content: Arjun Singh, a BJP leader, led a protest march against the Trinamool leader; they scuffled with police and blocked roads; protesters demanded capital punishment and said that the assault was deliberate

title: Workers, employers found Labour Codes credible, forward-looking: government report
content: “The overall perception scores indicate that stakeholders view the Labour Codes as a credible and forward-looking reform, reflecting confidence in their long-term relevance despite the acknowledged transitional nature of the current phase,” a report based on the survey said

title: Lokayukta officials trap Bescom engineer for taking ₹3 lakh bribe in Bengaluru
content: The arrested official has been identified as Rajesh K.V., executive engineer (electrical), E-11 Division, Bescom, Indiranagar

title: Karnataka Government will recalculate Namma Metro fares using Delhi Metro formula: DKS
content: Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar asserted that it was the State government that had taken the decision to halt the fare revision, rejecting claims by BJP leaders that the Union government had intervened to stop the hike

title: Activists urge stronger enforcement of Bonded Labour Act
content: According to data around 440 people were rescued from January 2023 till date, of them 209 have yet to receive the initial relief of ₹30,000; the State has fallen behind in the proper implementation of the Act say activists

title: Strike decisively against terrorism, Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor tells police
content: Manoj Sinha advises police to collaborate with every individual in society to eradicate terror networks; death anniversary of Afzal Guru passes off peacefully in Kashmir, with no shutdown call

title: Anaemia, blood disorders can distort diabetes test HbA1c results, says study
content: Any condition that affects the quantity, structure, or lifespan of haemoglobin — such as anaemia, haemoglobinopathies, or other red blood cell disorders — can distort HbA1c values and lead to misleading estimates of average blood glucose, the Lancet viewpoint article notes.

title: Allahabad High Court quashes criminal case against RWA office-bearers, flags misuse of RSS name
content: Says the general body of the society had passed a board resolution, framing parking guidelines to avoid traffic obstruction and hence nothing was done illegally.

title: EC using ‘very restrictive’ software tools unable to fathom ‘natural differences’, says Supreme Court
content: Top court asks poll body to extend claims-objections phase deadline by a week from February 14, directs West Bengal DGP to file a personal affidavit on allegations of violence, burning of documents

title: India, Greece to strengthen defence partnership, expand capacity of military industries
content: “Both Ministers reiterated that the partnership is rooted in shared values of peace, stability, freedom and mutual respect,” says Ministry of Defence

title: Kanpur pan masala baron’s son booked after reckless car crash
content: At least six persons were injured after a speeding Lamborghini, allegedly driven by Shivam Mishra rammed into pedestrians and two-wheelers on VIP Road in Kanpur’s upscale Gwaltoli area

title: Rahul has no interest in meaningful debate: BJP
content: BJP MP Anil Baluni called it the “height of irony”, that “a party which signed an MoU with the Communist Party of China now seeks to lecture the nation on security”.

title: Kittur MLA, Congress leaders participate in Hindu Samajotsava rally in Belagavi district
content: Babasaheb Patil and KPCC secretary Rohini Patil wore saffron shawls as they walked alongside other attendees

title: Foreign Secretary Misri doesn’t refute Trump’s claims, says ‘national interests’ guide oil imports
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri says import of oil decided by “adequate availability, fair pricing, and reliability of supply”; government set to brief parliamentary committee on trade deals with EU and the U.S.

title: Karnataka origin man working for LTIMindtree shot dead in Canada
content: Chandan Kumar, originally from Tyamagondlu, Nelamangala taluk, Bengaluru Rural district of Karnataka, was an Information Technology professional

title: Opposition corners Centre over unemployment, farmers’ woes during discussion on Budget in Rajya Sabha
content: Senior Congress leader P. Chidambaram said it was a ‘forgettable’ Budget, prepared by ‘a Finance Minister who forgot her promises made in this House last year’. Of 144 crore people in the country, less than two crore were employed in factories, he said and flagged the poor outcome of the PM’s internship scheme.

title: Abandoned Ships, Unpaid Crews: The Human Cost Of Shadow Fleets
content: The number of oil tankers and other commercial ships abandoned by their owners rose sharply last year, leaving thousands of sailors stuck at sea without pay, food or a way home.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What China's 'Secret' Nuclear Test Means (If It Really Did Happen)
content: The episode, if true, illustrates how ambiguity in one state's nuclear behaviour can reverberate across regions

title: 10-Crore Lamborghini "Had Issue Day Before Crash": Tobacco Baron's Big Claim
content: The probe into a high-profile Lamborghini crash in Kanpur has taken a turn after tobacco businessman KK Mishra, the father of the accused, publicly challenged the police version of events and offered an alternative account.

title: Seige Of Dhaka: When Hardline Hefazat-e-Islam Protested, And Nearly 100 Died
content: Bangladesh Election 2026: Bangladesh is preparing for another general election born out of a massive student-led uprising that overthrew the Sheikh Hasina-led government.

title: Top Court Directs Agencies To Speed Up Probe Into Anil Ambani-Linked Firms
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to move faster in their investigations into several Reliance Group companies.

title: 'US Forcing India To Buy Costly Oil': Russia Slams Trump's 'Energy Ban'
content: Russia has slammed the Donald Trump administration in the United States for trying to block India and other countries from buying Russian oil.

title: Karnataka Rebrands Tale Of 'Mysore Soap' With Tamannaah Bhatia. Controversy Follows
content: The appointment of Mumbai-born Tamannaah Bhatia as the brand ambassador of Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL) has sparked a row.

title: Mumbai Teen Hits Young Couple With SUV. He Used To Post Stunt Videos
content: Minors getting behind the wheel continue to pose a serious threat on Indian roads. The issue resurfaced yet again in Mumbai, where a late-night accident left a young couple fighting for their lives.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 10 LIVE Updates: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha Resume Proceedings
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates: Both the Houses of Parliament, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha resumed proceedings at 2:00 pm today.

title: Kiren Rijiju's "Most Degrading Behaviour" Jab At Congress With Video Of Parliament Showdown
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday shared a video of the confrontation that unfolded in the Lok Sabha on February 4, describing the conduct of Congress and Opposition MPs as "the most degrading behaviour".

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Case of Jewar Farmers: The Other Side Of Development
content: Historic infrastructure projects like Jewar Airport could transform the economic geography of regions, catalysing jobs and growth. But without robust financial management frameworks for those displaced by such projects, they are unsustainable.

title: How Delhi CA Lost Rs 75,000 In Minutes After Downloading File On WhatsApp
content: A case of cyber fraud has emerged from Delhi, where a chartered accountant was tricked into downloading a malicious file through WhatsApp under the promise of increasing her credit card limit.

title: With Starmer Under Epstein Row Fire, Can Shabana Mahmood Be UK's Next PM?
content: The political shockwaves from the Epstein files controversy are threatening to reshape Britain's power dynamics, with PM Keir Starmer facing growing calls to resign over his appointment of his former Labour colleague Peter Mandelson as the US envoy.

title: Can Higher Budget Help Delhi Achieve Clean Air Target By End Of 2026?
content: Delhi's struggle for basic essentials - clean water and clean air - is decades old. Today, the national capital is once again attempting to reclaim some breathable space.

title: Stephen Miller's Rise And His Role In Trump's Immigration Agenda
content: As Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy and Homeland Security Adviser, Miller has pushed for more deportation raids

title: NCP Workers' 1 AM Rampage After Hotel Staff Objects To Dancing On Tables
content: Workers affiliated with the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP, Ajit Pawar faction) allegedly vandalised a local hotel following a dispute over their celebratory behaviour. The entire incident was caught on CCTV cameras.

title: Indore Woman Exposes Husband's Drugs Racket, Records Video, Sends To Cops
content: Indore witnessed a dramatic twist in its fight against drugs when a woman herself exposed her husband's alleged narcotics racket by directly reaching out to the city's top cop.

title: International-Level Shooter Dies In Horror Crash. Fortuner Crushed By Truck
content: A major road accident on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad National Highway near Palghar's Manor in Maharashtra claimed the life of India's emerging international shooter Sambhaji Patil.

title: Biker Stabs Car Driver After Their Vehicles Collide In Madhya Pradesh
content: According to police, 27-year-old Akansh (Ekansh) Sahu, a furniture businessman, was driving his Creta car when the vehicle collided head-on with a motorcycle.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump's Claims vs Numbers: Can India Really Replace 87 Million Tonnes Of Russian Oil?
content: US and Venezuelan exports, even when taken together, fail to match the huge volume of crude India has been getting from Russia.

title: Who will hoist the Heisman in 2026? A way-too-early look
content: mendoza led the Hoosiers to a perfect 13-0 regular-season record . he beat out quarterbacks Diego Pavia, Julian Sayin and Jeremiyah Love to take home the trophy . there's a whole new crop of Heisman Trophy candidates for 2026 .

title: 🎵 Social reaction to Bad Bunny's halftime show
content: Bad Bunny gave fans nearly 13 minutes of energetic entertainment . he opened the performance with "Tit Me Preguntó" and transitioned to "Yo Perreo Sola" the sports world was well represented in the show .

title: From Josh Howlin to Barker Playfield: NFL-inspired pups headline Puppy Bowl XXII
content: the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots have a roster ready for the spotlight . team Fluff is a terrier-beagle from Nickel City Canine Rescue in Buffalo . she's joined by Barker Playfield, a nod to quarterback Baker Mayfield .

title: 'Go Hawks': Russell Wilson tops reaction to Seahawks' Super Bowl LX title
content: the Seattle Seahawks have won the Super Bowl for the second time in franchise history . the Patriots did not score on any of their first 10 possessions of the game . they tied with the Indianapolis Colts in super Bowl III for the fourth-longest streak .

title: Bad Bunny hosts wedding during Super Bowl LX halftime show
content: the couple featured in Bad Bunny's super bowl LX halftime performance was legally married . the couple was spotlighted several times during the show, beginning with a proposal early on . they got married surrounded by backup dancers .

title: Super Bowl 2026 commercials that feature athletes: Serena, Peyton and Hall of Fame tight ends
content: the ads feature athletes during super Bowl LX between the new England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks . the ads are often priceless, but the right ad can be priceless . there's often a hefty price attached to commercials, and this year is no different .

title: Best moments: The Bay records first win of the season over Los Angeles
content: The Bay beat los angeles 11-5 in a high-stakes match on tuesday night . the match was the first of its kind in the playoffs for the first time . a scoreless start through the first two holes of the match swung in The Bay's favor .

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.
